# rootRecord

**Instance Property**

The share’s root record.

## Declaration

```swift
@NSCopying var rootRecord: CKRecord? { get }
```

## Discussion

This property contains the root record of the shared record hierarchy if you set the [doc://com.apple.cloudkit/documentation/CloudKit/CKFetchShareMetadataOperation/shouldFetchRootRecord] property of the operation that fetches the metadata to [doc://com.apple.documentation/documentation/Swift/true]. You can specify which fields CloudKit returns by setting the same operation’s [doc://com.apple.cloudkit/documentation/CloudKit/CKFetchShareMetadataOperation/rootRecordDesiredKeys-3xrex] property.

The operation ignores the [doc://com.apple.cloudkit/documentation/CloudKit/CKFetchShareMetadataOperation/shouldFetchRootRecord] and [doc://com.apple.cloudkit/documentation/CloudKit/CKFetchShareMetadataOperation/rootRecordDesiredKeys-3xrex] properties when fetching a shared record zone’s metadata because, unlike a shared record hierarchy, a record zone doesn’t have a nominated root record.

## Accessing the Root Record

- **hierarchicalRootRecordID**: The record ID of the shared hierarchy’s root record.
- **rootRecordID**: The record ID of the share’s root record.
